column2: Description
Spinach fettucine. Assorted goods. Butchery.
"We take food seriously, but not too seriously."
Italian café with real, breathing baristas. Proscuitto-wrapped monkfish.
Ethiopian coffee. Digital hipsters.
Pan-Italian Kitchen
Gastropub servin' up American comfort food.
Chicken n' rice. White sauce. Red sauce (death).
Who doesn’t like/want barbecue?
Classically trained French chefs putting out beef ribs n’ pulled pork.
Best cheesecake. Cute place, highly rated cupcakes and all that jazz.
Classic hot dog in NYC.
Great corned beef hash. Not as good as Fox & Goose in Sacramento though. Perhaps the more animals you stuff in the name, the better it gets.
Salad will kick your ass. Train first before attempting.
is to In-and-Out.

Hyped up beyond all reason. But pretty good ramen and bao appetizers, after a two-hour long wait. Meh. Better the second time, no wait. Still not mind blowing. Not terrible if you get there early. Hypothesis? Long wait contributes to hangry-ness.
Rotisserie duck bowl + Pork buns.
Random café in NYC that had a fun selection of some specialty items. Fun for a casual sit-down after a long day of shopping.
“The Salty Pimp.” Biggest disappointment of my life. No better than a salty finish.
Meatballs theme in a bunch of ways. Get your balls in order. Try not to get kicked.
Most “inventive, avante garde” sushi place. Tuna tofu, black cod, foie gras?...well ducks can float...so technically it can go on a “sushi boat.”
Japanese skewers, char siu avocado, mentai potato. Small stools. Gets busy. Gets hawt for seats near the kitchen.
Lamb shawarma kicks ass.
Butter pecan crunch donut. Chicken biscuit breakfast sandwich with honey
Artichoke and spinach pizza. Super fatty, just like the dip on a slice.
Indian burritos. “Genius.” Paired with “shitty service.”
Dosas, cardamom coffee, chutneys. Crispy, huge, but some got dry chicken. Weird combinations sometimes don’t work. Incompatibility up the wazoo.
American-French fusion. Macadamia nut chicken salad, good cornbread. Many reviews that said the restaurant was just a hodgepodge of entrees designed to satisfy too many palates.
Yees. Yees. Yeeeees. Please.
Cakes, and surprisingly, crepes. OH WAIT. Crepe cakes. Chocolate banana, green tea, other shit.
Macarons. Coffee, pistachio, strawberry, salted caramel, OH TEH NOES!
Duck fat fries, kale salad, chicken and egg salad. Biscuits were good. Lots of “standard feelings” about the food.
Pork hock. Croissant sandwich with Brussels sprouts. Bloody Mary. “Mixed bag reviews.” Standard menu with twists.
Oysters. Seafood. Slightly expensive. “Good, but ain’t cheap.”
Crispy pig’s head. Awesome cocktails. Cheesecake panna cotta.
Monte Cristo. Bloody Mary. Bone Marrow (what? for brunch?). Hyped. Shitty service?
Small chain that serves good hummus n’ shit. Interesting, simple, hipster friendly.
Sandwiches and pickles up the wazoo. Really great pickles. Did I mention they have really interesting pickles?
Standard Indian place on the Upper West side. Sort of expensive.
Underwhelming Thai food. Twists on traditional recipes. Didn’t turn out well. Restaurant is shaped like a hallway (WTF) and they put cashews in their papaya salad (no).
Cute family-style restaurant with good Ethiopian.
Mmm...L.A is better. Donday, baby.

Brunch. Baked goods. Awesome french toast. Polenta muffin? Some reviews say, “Hm. weird,” which may mean good, but somewhat unsatisfying in an awkward way. Sort of like...I can’t think of a good analogy.
I’m surprised this didn’t come with 5000 searches. Crazily stocked, pay by the pound buffet. Full deli. Stuff. Good stuff. Breakfast buffet?
“Crack cupcakes.” “The cupcake craze is dead.” Sign in the window: “Unattended children will be given an espresso and a free puppy.” Wtf? Pedo-license. Check.
Super rich, super overrated...not a fan of cupcakes. I like to stick with “there was a cupcake craze?”
Seafood! Oysters, lobster roll...chocolate pudding (that’s seafood right?).

Banana pudding, red velvet. More cupcake nonsense, some say “meh.” I agree. Why cupcake when you can CHEESECAKE, scroll up to Eileen’s Special Cheesecake. L.A location next to Son of a Gun. "Not mindblowing," - Ames.
72nd. Good standard sushi.

Rice pudding. Sex, drugs, and rocky road is a flavor, apparently. Coo. Big portions, also have “mind-blowing” flavors like vanilla, cheesecake, and coconut coma. Fitting. Tasted apple cinnamon. Was okay.
Dim sum with english translations. SOMEONE SAY (magical) UNICORN?!
Japanese desserts. Brick toast with adzuki beans, green tea ice cream, black sesame creme brulee. “Generally overrated.”
Fancy schmancy dessert bar. “Heart gets poured into this place.” I hope it’s not real blended hearts.
Tibetan food. Cute atmosphere. Intimate. Food was okay.
One guess as to what they serve.
The MOST balanced ramen. Comparable to Ippudo. Less wait time, less hype. “Capable, and does not disappoint.”
Char siu pork ramen. Perfect texture on noodles. Competing in the ramen Olympics with Minca and Ippudo.
Original and Grandma's ramen.
Green curry and lemon pepper ramen?! Interesting…
Inside a Whole Foods.
Bahn-Mi Cambodian sandwiches.
Eh. Carne asada tacos were okay.
East Village Ice Cream.
Ice cream in Chelsea!
Working young professionals, early 30’s. Crowded. Felt young. Couldn’t get the attention of the bartender. Left. Live music Sundays.
Wine and cupcakes. Weird combination? Yes. Ain’t stopping some of us. Gut permeability anyone?
A better New York hog dog (a.k.a drunk food). I smell another overrated “Pink’s.”
Oxtail soup. Awwwww yeaaaaa.
Stuffed cornish game hen and flavorful tofu kimchee beef soup, and a single serving of galbi for 30 dollars?! WTF?
Matzoh ball soup. Hits me in my heart from Towne, in L.A, which is now closed.
Cute tapas place. Affordable. Tucked in a residential neighborhood. Cute.
Duck bacon, shakshuka, halloumi. Good Brunch.
Full-on English B-fast, chap. (Bro).
Best soup dumplings, says Peony (Amy's roommate).
FIREPLACE. BBQ. WHISKY. MEN. BEARDS. RAWR.
Smoked meat poutine. Oh gawds.
Salted caramel apple pie. It’s just too much, too much.
Brazilian fun.
Good American food. Under the Williamsburg bridge. Recommended by AJ.
Good American food. Under the Williamsburg bridge. Recommended by AJ.
More good American food. Recommended by AJ.
A consistently reliable 7.5/10 bowl of udon. Recommended by AJ.
Speakeasy-like eatery. Red velvet waffles and fried chicken. Amazing signature cocktails
Spicy lamb cumin hand pulled noodles. Recommended by Maggie.
Description
Recommended by Christine, who lives near the East Side. Closest thing she knows to a speak easy. Great scotch. Dangerous on the wallet.
Lychee martinis, all sorts of interesting boozy concoctions. Small plates, intimate atmosphere. Bring significant others, friends, but not strangers, otherwise the night might get “stale.”
“Drinks by the fireplace in this dim and cozy bar.” Lets do it.
Famous for “hot wassail.”

Downstairs, The Taproom, standing space only. Upstairs, The Parlour Room. Closed Sundays. Posh, quaint, serves old-style Irish authentic boozy punch in small cups and funtimes (not actually a menu item). First come first serve at 5. Full by 6. Get there early, bring good company, and your alcohol organ.
A bar recommended in Upper West. Expensive cocktails. Okay atmosphere. Good for a random drink.
Pretty sexy club with a nice drink list. Unfortunately, it’s not as quiet as you think. Perhaps at different times?
Analogous to a naked mistress in a trenchcoat. Tasty drinks, well-balanced...STRONG.
Lab-style sexy ass speakeasy. Sitting Buddha and Dear Prudence converted some cocktail hatin’ folks. Secret code needed.
More obese version of Little Branch (West Village). Stuck in midtown. Less shady?
An uncut umbilical from Momofuku. Brown-butter old fashioned. Rhum agricole daiquiri.
Super-sexy couch toting speakeasy
Intimate speakeasy. Recommended by AJ. Ginger cocktails.
Never crowded. Best date spot. Recommended by AJ.
Beautiful cocktail bar. Recommended by AJ.
Mezcal lovers and tequila. Recommended by AJ.
New location isn’t as good as original. Preference cocktails. Over 700 cocktails memorized. Kickass. Strong.
Good cocktails, fun vibe, late nights, drunk Frank. GO HOME!
Hot chocolate is said to be kickass. CHOCOLATE? WHERE AT!?!?
Excellent coffee. Aww yeah.
Good coffee and seating but fills up fast. On cold days.
Minimalist cawfee.
Small fun place to get your haircut. Mike’s got good dexterity.
Description
More koreatown.
Brunch.
Happy hours.
Cute bookstore that doesn’t use books for decoration, but for...oh shit...READING!
Taiwanese food n' shit.
Hipsterville
Food Festival. (Cemitas, Adobo Shack).
Honeycrisp apples.
